cmd:CorporateBodiesPersonsFamiliesDescri.cmd:history: The Yugoslav People's Army (Jugoslovenska narodna armija - JNA) was the armed force of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia between 1945 and 1992. The JNA originated in the World War II, from the armed forces of Yugoslav partisans, which in December 1941 organised under the name People's Liberation Army of Yugoslavia (Narodnooslobodilaƒçka vojska Jugoslavije - NOVJ). During the break-up of the former Yugoslavia and the ensuing armed conflicts, the JNA took an active role during the 1991 wars in Slovenia and Croatia, as well as in the initial stages of the war in Bosnia and Herzegovina in 1992. With the break-up of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia and the creation of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (comprising Serbia and Montenegro) in April of 1992, the JNA was transformed into the Army of Yugoslavia (Vojska Jugoslavije - VJ) in May 1992.
cmd:CorporateBodiesPersonsFamiliesDescri.cmd:places: Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia; Slovenia; Croatia; Bosnia and Herzegovina; Vukovar;
